alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Chesterfield; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 7:01AM EST until January 15 at 4:16PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River At Mattoax affecting Amelia, Powhatan and Chesterfield Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Appomattox River at Mattoax. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Agricultural and pasture land flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM EST Monday was 24.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 14.9 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.1 feet on 11/04/1949. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 430 PM EST.
